intro: Ditaxis, commonly known as the "beard of the desert," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, often pink or purple flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, adapted to harsh environmental conditions. The leaves are usually small, fleshy, and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss.
